11#ifndef CALL_ADAPTATION_RESOURCE_ADAPTATION_PROCESSOR_H_
12#define CALL_ADAPTATION_RESOURCE_ADAPTATION_PROCESSOR_H_
13
14#include <map>
15#include <memory>
16#include <string>
17#include <utility>
18#include <vector>
19
20#include "absl/types/optional.h"
21#include "api/adaptation/resource.h"
22#include "api/rtp_parameters.h"
23#include "api/scoped_refptr.h"
24#include "api/task_queue/task_queue_base.h"
25#include "api/video/video_adaptation_counters.h"
26#include "api/video/video_frame.h"
27#include "api/video/video_stream_encoder_observer.h"
28#include "call/adaptation/resource_adaptation_processor_interface.h"
29#include "call/adaptation/video_source_restrictions.h"
30#include "call/adaptation/video_stream_adapter.h"
31#include "call/adaptation/video_stream_input_state.h"
32#include "call/adaptation/video_stream_input_state_provider.h"
33
34namespace webrtc {
35
36// The Resource Adaptation Processor is responsible for reacting to resource
37// usage measurements (e.g. overusing or underusing CPU). When a resource is
38// overused the Processor is responsible for performing mitigations in order to
39// consume less resources.
40//
41// Today we have one Processor per VideoStreamEncoder and the Processor is only
42// capable of restricting resolution or frame rate of the encoded stream. In the
43// future we should have a single Processor responsible for all encoded streams,
44// and it should be capable of reconfiguring other things than just
45// VideoSourceRestrictions (e.g. reduce render frame rate).
46// See Resource-Adaptation hotlist:
47// https://bugs.chromium.org/u/590058293/hotlists/Resource-Adaptation
48//
49// The ResourceAdaptationProcessor is single-threaded. It may be constructed on
50// any thread but MUST subsequently be used and destroyed on a single sequence,
51// i.e. the "resource adaptation task queue". Resources can be added and removed
52// from any thread.
53class ResourceAdaptationProcessor : public ResourceAdaptationProcessorInterface,
54 public VideoSourceRestrictionsListener,
55 public ResourceListener {
56 public:
57 explicit ResourceAdaptationProcessor(
58 VideoStreamAdapter* video_stream_adapter);
59 ~ResourceAdaptationProcessor() override;
60
61 void SetTaskQueue(TaskQueueBase* task_queue) override;
62
63 // ResourceAdaptationProcessorInterface implementation.
64 void AddResourceLimitationsListener(
65 ResourceLimitationsListener* limitations_listener) override;
66 void RemoveResourceLimitationsListener(
67 ResourceLimitationsListener* limitations_listener) override;
68 void AddResource(rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource> resource) override;
69 std::vector<rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource>> GetResources() const override;
70 void RemoveResource(rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource> resource) override;
71
72 // ResourceListener implementation.
73 // Triggers OnResourceUnderuse() or OnResourceOveruse().
74 void OnResourceUsageStateMeasured(rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource> resource,
75 ResourceUsageState usage_state) override;
76
77 // VideoSourceRestrictionsListener implementation.
78 void OnVideoSourceRestrictionsUpdated(
79 VideoSourceRestrictions restrictions,
80 const VideoAdaptationCounters& adaptation_counters,
81 rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource> reason,
82 const VideoSourceRestrictions& unfiltered_restrictions) override;
83
84 private:
85 // If resource usage measurements happens off the adaptation task queue, this
86 // class takes care of posting the measurement for the processor to handle it
87 // on the adaptation task queue.
88 class ResourceListenerDelegate : public rtc::RefCountInterface,
89 public ResourceListener {
90 public:
91 explicit ResourceListenerDelegate(ResourceAdaptationProcessor* processor);
92
93 void SetTaskQueue(TaskQueueBase* task_queue);
94 void OnProcessorDestroyed();
95
96 // ResourceListener implementation.
97 void OnResourceUsageStateMeasured(rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource> resource,
98 ResourceUsageState usage_state) override;
99
100 private:
101 TaskQueueBase* task_queue_;
102 ResourceAdaptationProcessor* processor_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(task_queue_);
103 };
104
105 enum class MitigationResult {
106 kNotMostLimitedResource,
107 kSharedMostLimitedResource,
108 kRejectedByAdapter,
109 kAdaptationApplied,
110 };
111
112 struct MitigationResultAndLogMessage {
113 MitigationResultAndLogMessage();
114 MitigationResultAndLogMessage(MitigationResult result, std::string message);
115 MitigationResult result;
116 std::string message;
117 };
118
119 // Performs the adaptation by getting the next target, applying it and
120 // informing listeners of the new VideoSourceRestriction and adaptation
121 // counters.
122 MitigationResultAndLogMessage OnResourceUnderuse(
123 rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource> reason_resource);
124 MitigationResultAndLogMessage OnResourceOveruse(
125 rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource> reason_resource);
126
127 void UpdateResourceLimitations(rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource> reason_resource,
128 const VideoSourceRestrictions& restrictions,
129 const VideoAdaptationCounters& counters)
130 RTC_RUN_ON(task_queue_);
131
132 // Searches |adaptation_limits_by_resources_| for each resource with the
133 // highest total adaptation counts. Adaptation up may only occur if the
134 // resource performing the adaptation is the only most limited resource. This
135 // function returns the list of all most limited resources as well as the
136 // corresponding adaptation of that resource.
137 std::pair<std::vector<rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource>>,
138 VideoStreamAdapter::RestrictionsWithCounters>
139 FindMostLimitedResources() const RTC_RUN_ON(task_queue_);
140
141 void RemoveLimitationsImposedByResource(
142 rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource> resource);
143
144 TaskQueueBase* task_queue_;
145 rtc::scoped_refptr<ResourceListenerDelegate> resource_listener_delegate_;
146 // Input and output.
147 mutable Mutex resources_lock_;
148 std::vector<rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource>> resources_
149 RTC_GUARDED_BY(resources_lock_);
150 std::vector<ResourceLimitationsListener*> resource_limitations_listeners_
151 RTC_GUARDED_BY(task_queue_);
152 // Purely used for statistics, does not ensure mapped resources stay alive.
153 std::map<rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource>,
154 VideoStreamAdapter::RestrictionsWithCounters>
155 adaptation_limits_by_resources_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(task_queue_);
156 // Responsible for generating and applying possible adaptations.
157 VideoStreamAdapter* const stream_adapter_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(task_queue_);
158 VideoSourceRestrictions last_reported_source_restrictions_
159 RTC_GUARDED_BY(task_queue_);
160 // Keeps track of previous mitigation results per resource since the last
161 // successful adaptation. Used to avoid RTC_LOG spam.
162 std::map<Resource*, MitigationResult> previous_mitigation_results_
163 RTC_GUARDED_BY(task_queue_);
164};
165
166} // namespace webrtc
167
168#endif // CALL_ADAPTATION_RESOURCE_ADAPTATION_PROCESSOR_H_
